instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.AP_RESET_L: What is AP_RESET_L? AP_RESET_L resets the wifi hardware when it is low, which will keep it from working. AP_RESET_L needs to be high for reset to not be asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN: What is SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN? SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on power to the wifi circuit when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP3V3_WLAN: What is PP3V3_WLAN? PP3V3_WLAN is a 3.3v power rail that powers the wifi circuit or wifi card. This can go missing when the inductor acting as a fuse before PP3V3_WLAN blows..
definitions.AP_RESET_CONN_R_L: What is AP_RESET_CONN_R_L? AP_RESET_CONN_R_L resets the wifi hardware when it is low, which will keep it from working. AP_RESET_L needs to be high for reset to not be asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi guys. 

i have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a wifi issue. there was some liquid damage that i've fixed because it couldn't read the SSD. I managed to install it with the wifi working at the moment but now it stopped. I've replaced <CHIP>U3550</CHIP> and all voltages are going through it normally. When in OS trying to switch on the wifi it tries but not switching on. Any advice please?

Many thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"all voltages are going through it normally"
Depends what you consider normal; always better to post values.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Yes you're right.
<CHIP>U3550</CHIP> 
pin 2 and 4 are 3.3v
pin 1 and 3 are 3.3v
pin 6 is 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Sorry, I was thinking about <CHIP>U3540</CHIP>; post its voltages.

BTW (for the future), use schematic when you reffer to component pins, not boardview.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3540</CHIP>
pin1 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
pin2 <SIGNAL>P3V3WLAN_VMON</SIGNAL> - 1.1v <RESISTOR>R3554</RESISTOR> pin1 is 3.3v
pin3 <SIGNAL>AP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.1v
pin4 <SIGNAL>AP_RESET_CONN_R_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
pin5 GND
pin6 <SIGNAL>SMC_WIFI_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.4v
pin7 <SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_Q_L</SIGNAL> - 0v <RESISTOR>R3553</RESISTOR> pin1 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_WLAN</SIGNAL> is 3.v
pin8 - 0v
pin9 GND

Replaced <RESISTOR>R1342</RESISTOR> , <RESISTOR>R3555</RESISTOR> , <RESISTOR>R3554</RESISTOR> , <RESISTOR>R3553</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Why did you replace it?
All voltages are good.

Try another airport card, clean the connector.
Check <SIGNAL>PCIE_AP</SIGNAL> data/clock traces and components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: There was liquid damage so i was good to be replaced. Also i tried another airport card
